facebook.title: Could a text increase college enrollment or student achievement?
facebook.summary:
Surprisingly simple behavioral interventions -- like a timely text or letter -- can achieve positive results in education.

An expert from Teachers College, Columbia University looks at how and why they work.

blogs.title: Can Tweets Or Text Messages Increase College Enrollment Or Student Achievement?
blogs.summary:
Peter Bergman, Teachers College, Columbia University
Can a few text messages, a timely email or a letter increase college enrollment and student achievement? Such “nudges,” designed carefully using behavioral economics, can be effective.
